Pros:
I'm not the type of guy to criticize Art, I'm relatively indifferent to this aspect as it rarely impedes my enjoyment. I'll tell you this though, if you're looking for a nostalgic One Piece feel, this should fit your criteria (art-wise anyways). Due to my personal bias,this definitely bumped the show up a few notches.


The music is quite memorable. It does it's job. The battle music is very "action-y", for a lack of a better term, and gets manages to get you hyped without fail.


The story as well as the lore of the of the anime were quite refreshing. It may have been that I was just craving another anime revolving around guilds and mages, but I found it quite enjoyable.


Cons:

The characters are obnoxious. Dear God do they annoy me so. Why you ask? Well let's start with the main character. 

The main character is stupid. Yes, stupid. Like all shounen anime main characters, the main character has to be obligatorily mentally slow. His remarks were entertaining for only a brief moment. Then it started to hurt. I may just have a short temper, but I found it hard to not yell at my screen whenever he opened his goddamn mouth and spouted his incoherent garbage (it's not that bad, I'm exaggerating). Only when he goes into battle does his speech come off as acceptable, but even then, he's an overconfident prick. Now his gag of a weakness. His sickness on any form of transportation. This annoyed me to a horribly large degree. Why? Just why? Why the fuck would you make something like this his weakness? It's just fucking stupid like the rest of the character.

Not enough for you? Well how about the rest of the characters?

All the females give off the I'll-lay-you-for-a-dollar-and-then-leave-with-your-wallet vibe. The males are blatantly the huh-you-wanna-fight-huh-punkass-faggot-huh-fight-me-let's-go-bro-fight-me muscle-headed men.


Enjoyment? Other than the few brief moments within the first 3 minutes, I felt nothing but pain. It's overly cliché. Allow me to take a portion of the dialogue from every intense fight scene.


Bad Guy: "Huh? How the hell are you still standing?"

Good Guy: "Heh... you really are strong... But do you want to know the difference between me and you?"

Bad Guy: "...?"

Good Guy: "I HAVE FRIENDS"

Bad Guy: "DEAR GOD NO"


Overall 5/10 - Those 3 minutes along with the art and music really saved it there. Cons aside, this would be a great anime for first-time viewers. I highly recommend it. If you happen to be an "anime connoisseur" and you want to pick this up, I say to you: don't. Jokes aside, you really shouldn't decide if you want to watch or not based on my opinion. Disregard all I've and go watch it yourself you priss. I can't do all the work. It's only like 22-24 minutes per episode.

Fairy tail is one of those shows that has had a lot of attention on it for along time - both with lots of praise and lots of bashing. Many has some kind of opinion of it,  so what the show really manages to do is provoking emotions - good or bad. I personally has watched all existing episodes (minus some filler arcs, but I come to that later), and are up to date with the manga so I have had time to given it some thought. I gonna be honest, the first time I tried to watch it, I dropped it after 2episodes with the thought to maybe check it out later - it felt pretty childish. When I again picked it up and started giving it a serious shot, Fairy tail  soon started to grow a lot on me until I had given most of my holiday on it. I´m may be slightly biased in this case, but I are absolutely not blind to the shows flaws - the show is by no means perfect in many ways. But I truly love the show, flaws and all. Yes, it´s many time childish and over expresses emotions. Yes, many times we get random mood breaking comedy and cliche battle speeches. Yes, most of the power-ups is because of "I do this for my friends" kinda of motivations. And you know what? It doesn´t bother me at all, which is strange because that kind of stuff can easily irritate me. But in Fairy tails case I grow to love the show for it just that instead. It´s hard to not compare Fairy tail against the other big shounen names out there (Bleach, Naruto, One Piece, DBZ, Hunter x Hunter etc.), but it also should be able to be judged on its own premises. In my review of Fairy tail I have done bit of both - compared it to the big ones and how it stand alone. 


Story: 8/10

I should first mention that I give the score based on Fairy tail as o whole (anime + manga) and minus the filler arcs. Why? Because i don´t think the filler arc has the same feeling as the manga based material at all ( I recommend that you skip those), and that all story´s should be judged when you have most of the whole picture. So, down to business. I actually for the most part really enjoyed the story with it´s crazy random little inputs, bonding moments and major battles. If you really pay attention to the plot, you will see that the show many times are very well thought throw and detailed. It can be information in what you think was just a random comment/conversation and so on. But all the time you get clues to the major plot and upcoming events. Hiro Mashima has really managed to create a detailed and awesome fantasy world. Even when you think important plot progressions, like the background and function of the dragon slayers, are lost in the sea of events somewhere - don´t get your hopes down. The story slowly builds up to those moments (yes, sometimes waaay to slow, but hey? Arn´t we used to that by know?). Yes, sometimes the story seems to go at totally random direction (and can many times do so), but the major plot, battles and mysteries are put out there from the start and links together more and more as the series progresses. The manga is still ongoing and Hiro (the creator of the manga Fairy tail) will be directly involved in the upcoming seasons. What I have seen is many complains about is the many times overused fan-service. It´s absolutely true - it used a lot. Shore, some serious battles and moments are ruined by it (Hiro you pervert), but it dosent take away the feeling that Fairy tails story and characters are all about (at least not for me). The complexity and details of the Fiore and it´s history, the guilds and political structures, the use of magic and the different types (you got fire magic, air, water, metal and so on), character relationships, time travelling, magical experiments, dragons and demons, makes Fairy tail to one of the biggest and best adventure story´s in anime out to date. It has a heavy focus on friendships, believes, loyalty, determination and love. All the things that brings together a strong family and team. If that kind of stuff annoys you, don´t watch this - Fairy tail is all about that. Sometimes you can have a bit of hard time to feel the characters pain in battles, due to that we see very little blood and deaths in this show. Dirt and bruises yes, but nothing like Ichigo almost bleeding out against Kenpachi. What we do got a lot of instead, is lot of different magic attacks, fist fights and explosions. Some of the magic attacks are really crazy (in a good way), so you can´t relay on that the strongest fighter will win - some times  it´s the fighter with most secret attacks and dirty tricks that will come out victorious. Do Fairy tail has an original story? As a base no (strong wizards fighting against all odds, and wins over and over again, friendships trumps over all and that kind of stuff). In it´s execution? Yes. The world and details of it (magic, history, guilds, inventions and so on) are very original and unique to Fairy tail. Of course some arcs are a bit weaker and sometimes a bit exaggerated border to childish. But then we have some real strong ones (as for example"Tower of Heaven arc" and "Tenrou Island arc"). As the story progresses the mood of the show and it´s enemies gets more serious, so it will not stay in it´s initially childish mode (for most parts any way).   


Art: 7/10

The art isn´t that great compared to many other shows. But have in mind that this is a long running show, which has a tighter budget to every episode.  It is how ever produced by to major studios ( A-1 picture and Satelight), which are shown with some really nice settings when money are put in to them, and much of the magic gets time to really shine (for example Natsus fire magic). What they have manage to do, and should get credit for, is that they have stayed true to the manga´s art. All character has their unique designs and some are just so weird - but it´s Fairy tails crazy world so I think they fit in perfectly. Some fight scenes are a bit hard to fallow do to some so called "cut-and-past" feeling to them, so don´t expect top class fights as in for example the Fate series. But it also has equally as many detailed and crazy nice fight scenes. Facial expression is very strong and clear, and many times the body movements to. All over I think the art and animation suites it purpose and the show it self.


Sound: 10/10

Here i´m getting a bit excited. I absolutely freaking love the soundtrack! The soundtrack is dominated by Irish/Celtic folk influenced rock. It´s makes a fantastic job of bring out that feeling only Fairy tail can bring out in me. It´s well composed, well coordinated and right up epic (for example "Dragon force" or "Fairy tails main theme"). I´m glad that they decided to stay with it all through all the anime, and just add some new song here so it wouldn´t get boring. The OP´s are all very energetic and catchy. They suites the show great and often follows the mood of the arc it used for. All OP´s  also showcases a lot of clues of what gonna happen in the following episodes, which I thought was brilliant. It peaked my curiosity of what´s gonna happen next. ED´s are a bit goofy at the beginning but if you watch them to the end, the showcases a lot of emotional stuff for selected characters. Many random sounds highlighting the comical aspects of the show. For VA, I watched the dubbed, and I actually liked them all. They played their part very well. They manage in most cases to catch the core of the character. 


Character: 10/10

Also here I think it´s one of Fairy tails strongest parts. Like for example Bleach, it has a broad cast of characters, many with unique features and personalities. As for character developments it varies, but what ever you love or hate the character - the character will force some emotions from you. I´m still a bit awed in the sense of Hiro´s imagination of creating all of these strong and colorful characters. Our main crew is Natsu, Lucy, Erza and Grey. Of them I think Erza and Gray have the greatest development (both personal wise and in fighting skills). But the charm in Fairy tails characters lays not in a major character development - is´s in their characteristic personalities. You know there you have them. Natsu gonna get motion sick and run head first in a fight without any strategy, Lucy is gonna end up in small cloths and win by some random luck chance, Erza will hold speeches about the light in ones heart and go berserk in one of her armors, and Grey will say typical cool boy stuff and freeze people up. It´s what I like about them. The most enjoyable thing with Fairy tails characters is the dynamic between them, and how much team Fairy tail regards each other and innocent life. Some characters are plain weirdos and some are archetypes, but in their own unique design and little role to fill. Most character are being reused in a good manor, to fill other important roles in the story. To follow the Fairy tail crews journeys was nothing but awesome for me. Some canon and still up for discussions relationships are also very heart warming and well matched. You gonna get some strong moments with your favorites, that´s for shore. Many of the main and supporting cast is also  given well deserved detailed backgrounds and in real time attention.


Enjoyment: 10/10

I had a absolute blast watching this show, and giving the show a 10 despite some obvious flaws in the plot, character developments and in the animation. In it´s imperfection Fairy tail has so much to it, which brings a unique feeling to it. I call it "The Fairy tail feeling". I benched watched all that was out in no time at all, sometimes I even forgot to eat! Total Fairy tail deep dive. 


Overall: 10/10

Just looked on briefly Fairy tail may appear very childish, repetitive and some times even stupid. But if you look down under the surface you soon see a much deeper show, with characters that will be hardly tested and a plot that actually has a direction. You just has to give it the time it takes to evolve. Overall very enjoyably to me. I started to read the manga as soon as the last episode was watched. And of that I can state that the upcoming season is gonna be totally badass - for shore the best so far. It´s where we gonna get some answers to long asked questions and see what everything else has build up to. 


"The biggest mistake you ever made, was to mess with Fairy tail" - The Fairy tail Guild members

Fairy tail was mu first anime and I thought this was the best anime (since it was my first ever anime) As I watched more and more anime, I realized that fairy tail was NOT the best anime.

The thing that really annoyed me about these arcs were that there is a flashback every single time natsu gets beat up or someone in the fairy tail guild get beat up. And the say Natsu beats the bad guy is really repetitive and boring time to time.
Art(7): I'm tremendously badat art so Im not going to put any description for this part.


Sound(10): Fairy Tail's OST and OPs are amazing. It was Phenomenal. Even though the Arc was somewhat boring, the OST helped it bring some hype to it

Fairy Tail. It's one of the most popular, long-running battle shounen series out there. Now, you're probably wondering whether or not you should check out this anime... I mean, why else would you be here, reading this? This review will go over all the main points of the series and analyse both its weak and strong points alike, and hopefully help you out in your decision.
The first thing you should know about Fairy Tail is that the first season is part of a bigger story that continues on in the second season, which ups the total episode count by another 110 -  but there'sno need to worry about any of that. Once you finish that 175th episode, you should be able to judge for yourself whether or not you'll want to continue watching the series.


Story: 6/10

I'll be skipping over the synopsis, since it's already at the top of the page. Fairy Tail's story isn't exactly very deep, and it takes some time to get going anywhere. Much like other long-running series, it is split up in multiple shorter story arcs that are all connected together. Each of these story arcs either moves the plot forward or reveals new information about the characters, or both in some cases. One potential problem Fairy Tail has is the issue with repetition, as in each new story arc introducing a new big bad that must be defeated, appearing incredibly powerful at first, but in the end gets defeated, thanks to the good guys all working together and the strong bonds they share. However, if this is what you want from your battle shounen series, then Fairy Tail delivers it in spades.


Characters: 9/10

I can safely say the characters are one of Fairy Tail's strongest points, and easily make up for the lack of a deep storyline. The large cast of main and side protagonists are all very likeable, each with their own unique quirks, strengths and weaknesses, and the way they all interact with each other is very enjoyable to watch. There is plenty of character development, though some of it moves at a slow pace, and may not be immediately obvious until you look back at older episodes again.

Most of the villains, admittedly, are a little less interesting and are often just bad guys because they are, though some do get their own backstories and a few even turn to the good side later on in the story.

There are also hints of romance and many cute moments between many of the characters, but none of it really goes anywhere. If you're looking for strong romance, you won't find it here.


Visuals: 7/10

The art in Fairy Tail is frankly nothing super impressive at a technical level, but it still looks nice and colourful and is overall just easy on the eyes. While the quality of the animation isn't amazing either (which is to be expected from a long-running series like this), it does manage to stay pretty consistent throughout the entirety of its 175 episodes. All in all, it isn't a masterpiece to look at, but at least it doesn't cut corners wherever it can or suffers from huge quality discrepancy between episodes or scenes.


Sound: 10/10

The amazing soundtrack is what got me interested in Fairy Tail in the first place. It's simply perfect and I couldn't wish for anything better. The Irish/Celtic inspired sound in a lot of the tracks really helps set the series apart from the others. The battle music can only be labelled as "god-tier", and really gets your adrenaline pumping during the climaxes. Even in the less interesting scenes of the anime, the music helps make it more tolerable to watch.

Other than the soundtrack, all the character's voices are pleasant to listen to as well and sound like you'd expect the characters to sound like. The voices are full of emotion and passion, strengthening the scenes with intense action or sadness even further. While I didn't think the English dub was as good as the Japanese version, it manages to range between tolerable to good, making it a viable choice if you prefer watching it in English.


Enjoyment: 9/10

If you've already seen the overall score I gave this anime, it's needless to say I really enjoyed Fairy Tail. Compared to other long-running battle shounens, Fairy Tail is a breath of fresh air, mainly thanks to its strong pacing. Even though the first season is 175 episodes long, there is so much stuff happening, and all of it happens at a reasonable pace. Battles generally don't take more than a single episode to end, with the exception of some of the boss fights, and individual story arcs are usually concluded within 12-26 episodes. The battles, while lacking the depth some other battle shounens may have, are just much more enjoyable to watch because the characters are actually doing something, instead of having to explain every little thing they're doing. Some of the more special techniques will get an explanation, but it's always kept short and to the point.

I also love how light-hearted the series is, thanks to its many comedic moments, but still has plenty serious and emotional scenes as well, and it manages to find a solid balance between all of these elements.


That said, it's certainly not without its flaws. It does move slow at certain points, and there's one fairly lengthy filler arc that, honestly, wasn't very interesting to watch for the most part. As mentioned before, the animation isn't always the greatest, and sometimes make you wish it just was a little better during some of the big battles.


Overall: 8/10

Fairy Tail is a blast to watch and I could easily recommend it to anyone looking for something that involves plenty of light-hearted comedy and explosive combat scenes, accompanied by an amazing soundtrack.

When i started reading/watching the manga and the anime of Fairy Tail i was really enthusiastic.
As someone who grew up watching shounen this anime had everything i was looking for genre-wise: a huge cast of characters with amazing and diverse powers, jaw-dropping battles, and an interesting plot that i thought could only get better by each episode.
The problem was... that as time passed by, everything that originally made me gasp and yelled in excitement, grew duller and duller. 
The first few arcs of the story, in my opinion, were really enjoyable. But suddenly it became painfully repetitive, and instead of giving an answers to allthe questions that were presented in the beginning, they kept adding more and more. More villains, more characters, more unanswered questions. Suddenly they were dealing with alternative realities and time travel, and so many things that were far away from the original plot... and sadly i had to stop watching it all together as i wasn't having fun anymore. \n
In my opinion, this constant necessity of adding and adding is what killed this poor anime. It could have been SO much better if they decided to concentrate in only one thing at the time, instead of scattering storylines everywhere. \n\n
That said, the first few arcs of the story are worth watching. I like the four lead characters a bunch, they are very diverse and have likable personalities. \n
But if you decided to start watching, keep in mind that it will start getting old somewhere in the way. \n

After watching the last episode, I decided that I had to review Fairy Tail. I just cannot wait for the sequel.
Story: 6
Now the story for ft isn't anything amazing. There is no one overarching plot throughout the show. Instead we have many story arcs of different lengths. Some can last as little as 5 episodes and others can go on for 20+ episodes. Some of the initial few arcs can be dull, however as the show goes on the arcs become a lot more interesting. 
Art: 9
The art for fairy tail was fantastic. One gets to see all kinds of characters with such vibrant colours.For example we have Erza with her red hair, Lucy with her Blonde hair and Wendy with her Blue hair. It is a joy to see the animation of the characters, and I just loved the artwork. \n\n
Sound: 10\n
This is probably Fairy Tail's strongest point. The soundtrack is amazing. There is an amazing soundtrack for almost every moment in the show. From the action scenes to some of the more sad moments in the show. A majority of the opening and endings are quite fun to listen to. I particularly remember Opening 9 and Ending 6 as being two of my favourites. Almost ever character has their own theme and almost all are quite amazing, my favourite being Mystogan's theme. \n\n
Character: 9\n
I loved so many of the characters from fairy tail. One gets such a diverse set of characters. We have some mysterious characters, such as Mystogan. Then we have the more brash and arrogant characters such as Laxus. Then we have the more comedic characters such as Natsu. However one of the common traits in all of these characters is their loyalty to one another. This is one of the most important traits in the show. \n\n
Enjoyment: 9\n
Fairy Tail was quite enjoyable. There is a perfect mix of comedy with action. The action sequences are quite enjoyable to watch, especially some of the battle scenes in Tenrou and Grand Magic Games.\n\n
Overall: 9\n
I really enjoyed watching Fairy Tail. Some very interesting story arcs along with impressive artwork, amazing soundtracks and some great characters truly make fairy tail a joy to watch.

The year is 2016, and nearly every major Shonen anime/manga is coming to an end. Bleach is done and dusted, Naruto packed up late 2015 and we are not too sure how much life 'the king of Shonen' One Piece has left in it. But at 265 episodes and counting (I am presuming another season has been announced...), Fairy Tail shows no signs of stopping (at least not in the manga!)!
The show centers around how magic can be used for everybody's personal life, and how select groups make guilds of magicians to take up quests people are too afraid of doing themselves. Ones such guildis Fairy Tail, the strongest of them all. As the show progresses, we are introduced to the wild and wacky characters Fairy Tail has in it's ranks.


The 'main four' we focus on are Natsu Dragneel, Lucy Heartfillia, Grey Fullbuster and Erza Scarlett. Natsu is the lead man, and a 'dragon slayer magic' user, taught to him by his adopted father Igneal, who is also a dragon. Igneal left Natsu when he was young, and only left him a scarf, which he wears ALL the time! Natsu is inseperable from his pet talking cat, Happy and hates any type of moving transport. His rivalry with Grey is considered one of the all time best anime bromances.


Lucy Heartfillia is a new member to Fairy Tail, and a 'celestial' wizard who uses keys to call upon spirits that are embodiments of the 12 gemini star systems. She is a lovely girl, but her try hard, do hard, work hard ethic has put her in the middle of many battles. We are still not too sure whether she has a crush on Natsu or not, but it is heavily implied that the two are quite fond of each other.


Grey Fullbuster AKA that naked man, is an 'ice-make' magic wizard, who can make anything out of ice as long as there is a decent amount of water nearby. Cocky, arrogant, and ready to do what he wants in a heartbeat, Grey also has a soft side for his friends. Juvia Lockster definitely has the hots for him, and is seen gawking at him whenever he takes off his clothes subconsciously (yes, this happens....a lot!).


And finally, Erza Grey. The fierce knight wizard who can change her armour and swords at a blink of an eye. If your lucking for video game look alikes, both personality wise and look wise, she reminds me of Lightning (Claire Farron) from Final Fantasy XIII. Her atitude gives her a natural leader impression, although most of the guild fear her so much.


There are many more characters in the show; Juvia Lockster is Grey's creepy water magic stalker, Happy is Natsu's pet talking cat, Elfman, Lissana and Mirajane are magicians that can let spirits take over there body, and then we have Makarov who is a friendly old man...unless he spanks you...


The first few arcs made me fall asleep though. The fight scenes were good, but the story around them was just so bad. It was like watching Gintama. Not saying that IS bad, but this anime showed more comedy then story in those episodes. In fact, it was not until the Tower of Heaven arc I really got interested in. The later arcs like the Battle for Fairy Tail and the Tenrou Island arcs are even better, and after the time skip we have the best arcs of them all.


Pros:

-It brings a unique blend of comedy and story, rivalling that of Gintama (a little too close to Gintama...)

-Magic being used in anime is completely unheard of unless it is a magic girl anime. This changed that stereotype.

-One of the 'big four' Shonen anime that are known worldwide to non-anime fans.

-Arcs are very different. You don't know what you are expecting next!


Cons:

-The show relies too much on humour as a redundancy plan. They have too much comedy over action, which makes it a Gintama knock-off

-Some of the characters are really bland. I can't stand Gajeel or Loke!

-It is currently unknown when the next season will air...if it will air


Stamp of Approval:

 -I give each anime I review a stamp of approval. A rated-BAD stamp means I would skip it, rated-Meh means I would watch it only if you have watched my reccomendations below, rated-Shining! means you should stream it to see if you will like it, rated-Golden! means you should buy this no matter what, and if it gets a certified ++ rating, it is one of the best anime I have ever laid my eyes on.


For Fairy Tail, I am going to give it a Rated-Shining! It is a great anime for Shonen fans, but for those who want a short series your in the wrong place. FT is a great anime, but I would leave it if your not ready for a commitment.


Reccomendations:


One Piece - 'King of Shonen' One Piece! Luffy the pirate takes on the world for his quest to become the Pirate King!


Yu-Gi-Oh! - In a time when card games are the next big hobby, a young boy is taken over by the spirit of an ancient Pharaoh to save the life of his Grandfather...and the world!

Fairy Tail is awesome. This is the typical shonen series but without many of the flaws of say bleach or DBZ (and I still Love DBZ to the end). This is an all around great anime. The music is epic and it really pushes the emotion of the story. The arcs are what impress me the most. The length of each arc is just right in my opinion. They don't drag it out, plain and simple. Not only that they are well thought out. The characters are stereotypical but the dimensional characters do not drag down the story. Also there back stories are really interestingwhich makes them more interesting. The most important part is the action, though I would not say it is as cool as DBZ's the action does get me pumped up which is what I personally look for in this type of series. So this is a great series and I would recommend marithoning it by arc because waiting every week takes away from the story and emotion.

I understand that some people say this anime is really bad because of the fighting or the continuous useless fights but I enjoyed this anime very much. This anime shows real friendship and hardworking people that I had never had in my life. Fairy Tail practically changed my life of thinking. I agree that sometimes that the fighting parts can get really annoying and you can actually sense what's gonna happen because of the repeating fights. 
Story 8- The story was very good since it had all the things I was looking for ex. fights, a bit of love, magic, dragons, fuuny etc. Fairy Tailcan make you laugh a lot. Not only the show and their way of thinking but even the characters can make you laugh out loud. The only thing that wasn't really good was the fact that you can guess what's gonna happen and the fights are really repetitive. Fights repeat the whole time so it gets a bit boring sometimes.


Art 9- First few episodes, the art wasn't very good. It wasn't really detailed and it seemed a little bit off but after a few seasons the art has improved over time and became wonderful. I gave it a 9 because of the art in the first few episodes


Sound 9- The sound is really good. They have the best battle musics I've ever heard in all the other anime's I had watched. The music encourages you to watch more and it makes much more suspision out of it.( that's all I can say about it)


Character 8- I liked most of the characters but some of the characters are really annoying and I didn't like them. All of them have really special personalities that I personally like but some.... not so much. It's not like it is because of how they look or whatever, it is because their personalities are annoying, selfish, powerless, talkative etc.


Enjoyment 8- I personally enjoyed the show very much becuase of the characters, music, arts etc. All episodes gives you curiosity and makes it really enjoyable. Even though people think it's really bad I recommend you to watch this;)

This review may contain Spoilers!
Shall we start with the easy stuff; Art & Sound.
Without saying the best what the Anime has gotten. The themes are quite good and remain in your mind even long after you finished wathing FT. The art is nice - a huge variety of colours are given.
Characters...
Well, it's neither very good nor very bad at all. There's a plenty of characters I like, such as Jellal, Lyon, Erza or Gray. But on the other hand there's a remarkably amount of People I don't like at all! I'm going to run through both sides and let you know why I like themor not.


First of all, the main character, namely: Natsu, Happy, Lucy, Erza and Gray. I'm very particular with this order and soon you will know, why?!


Natsu is one of the worst main protagonists I've ever seen. He's dumb as hell, gets ZERO character development and wins all battles, all the time! Having said that, it seems that he's absolutely the only one, who could fight against the main "bad" guy. That's why the entire stories of each arc are so predictable... it's not even funny anymore!


Happy - funny and annoying at the same time - is Natsus little fellow. He keeps pushing Natsu into troubles, helps him out,... yaya, we know what he's actually doing.


Lucy, smart and sexy... she has some ups and downs during the anime and I've got the feeling she slightly enjoys getting herself into troubles - Natsu will save her either way. Because of that and the fact she seems not being able to keep herselt out of it, I did ask myself repetitively: Why? Why always Lucy? The "bad" guys are, most of the time, looking for her...


Anyway, we've got Erza. In my point of view, her past (the time in the Tower & Jellal) is probably one of the better ones in the series even tough we didn't get see how she became so stro ng as she actually is. But she shows personality - the first of the main characters who seriously does. But - let's go down to Business - and she turns into a sword-fighting monster. Still, I like her.


Gray was in the first episodes definitely one of the main characters, but as the stories goes on, he seems more and more like a supporting character than anything else. I do enjoy Gray because of how he uses and forms the ice which is he's given element. But it seems the producer "gave" him a certain limit and he is not allowed to go further than this limit - that's why he's sort of useless. And as the Serie goes an he turns more and more into a copy of Natsu... sad, but true.


Fairy Tail's "bad" guys are another disappointing fact - they're bad, because they're bad. Most of the time no reason is given. And most of them haven't gotten any background story anyway. 


Well then... the last thing to talk about is the story. It actually had potential - countless times something started very interestingly and turned out to be just "another arc with another bad guy who wants to rule the world or destroy fairy tail".

To close this paragraph I must say I like the fact that after the timeskip they haven't changed at all. Some of them even not their appearance. Yet seven years have passed... *forever young*

The most ridiculous thing I found was the fact no one, except one supporting character, died - Simon. But they had to deal with enormously dangerous guys (at least they seemed so) and none of them died.


The anime would have some gread, and even memorable, moments; however, since every arc is so predicable and ends in almost the same way as the previous one did, you can already imagine the upcoming arc although you haven't gotten the slightest idea about what it might be.


Another interesting thing is that Jellal made it to become one of my favourite characters of all Animes I've watched so far. As I mentioned earlier, I like Erza, Lyon and Gray as well and I do hope they'll get more screen-time and background story.

First off, I disagree with all the people who simply rated this show 1-3 based on the fact that there was not character development after watching 175 episodes... The fact of the matter is that the show got them to watch those episodes, did it not? In that way it succeeded. People don't watch "okay" tv shows that go on forever because of their fantastic and visionary story... They watch it because it's enjoyable (which is what this anime is all about).
Fairy Tail is a frustratingly inconsistent show. The show sometimes develops fantastic stories, and sometimes the plots are extremely shallow or even nonexistent. Sometimesthere are beautiful character backgrounds or relationship developments, but then sometimes they get thrown away and replaced with very repetitive character interaction. Almost always the pacing of the anime is really good, but I distinctly recall a part around ep. 40 or so when all of a sudden the direction of the anime must have changed or something, because all the dialogue and action felt really slow and disjointed.


Nonetheless, the consistent part of this show is its ability to drag you back and continue watching. Usually the story arcs are very interesting (with a couple key exceptions), and the anime has several key threads running always that develop slowly yet steadily, making you hungry for more information. Even though the theme - of the main characters just being pushed to the limit and getting stronger every time - just occurs over and over again, watching Natsu beat up more and more people doesn't really cease to be enjoyable (at least in my opinion).


What makes it all the better is when the story gets good, it really gets good. I particularly remember some really OMG moments as everything that I thought about the show was blown away when it took a turn in a direction I could have never expected.


At the same time, I enjoyed how this anime was fine with having fun with itself. Characters sometimes broke the fourth wall, referred to past events with irony, provided plenty of fanservice (at least plenty of female, some male as well), and joked in a very amusing way. It was a very good action-comedy in this sense.


All in all, don't go in looking for perfection. This isn't one of those superbly well thought out animes - if you're looking for that, I'd recommend Steins;gate or Code Geass or FullMetal Alchemist Brotherhood, or something along those lines. But Fairy Tail will provide you with hours (and hours and hours) of entertainment, so give it a try!

Fairy Tail. What to say about it? I for one was pleasantly surprised by this anime. I went into this expecting another stupid harem anime with countless of panty shots, which would have been dreadful. I only sat down to watch this because people kept telling me this was an outstanding anime, where others said it was horrible, so I was really torn whether to give it a chance. And boy am I glad I did.
At the time I started watching this anime, only 52 episodes (or so) had been released, and I am not lying when I say I marathoned them all in twodays. I was hooked at about episode 4. 


Enough chit-chat though. Review time! (Keep in mind this is my first review ever, so bear with me)


Story: 7

The story starts out introducing us to the world of Fiore, a peaceful country ruled by magic of all sorts. Within this country, guilds for mages are stationed about, each having their own way of living life along the people without magical powers, by doing jobs to help various people, using their magic. By this point I was thinking this was gonna be a decent anime, no matter which way they turned it. We're introduced to the main characters and their guild, Fairy Tail, and soon they have problems (of different kinds) on their hands. Following their progress through all these problems was an enjoyment I looked forward to every Saturday and I still miss the thrill of seeing some of my favorite characters kick the villain's face in.


Well having me ramble on about every arc's ups and downs, will take forever, so I'll just say; I thoroughly enjoyed the story as it were, and see no reason to complain.


Art: 6

The art was a disappointment on my part. There weren't, at any point, a moment where I  thought; "Wow that is really great animation", like I've caught myself do in other anime. I gotta say though, I've seen worse then Fairy Tail and I would also say that it's pretty decent in the last couple of episodes. The huge amount of fan-service bothered me a bit, but they had to appeal to the male audience somehow. Plus if you've seen High School of The Dead, it doesn't bother you at all..


Sound: 9

If one thing drew me in about Fairy Tail, it would be the soundtrack. The different kinds of music each scene brought had me ripped along with the mood, whether it was an action or an emotional scene. The soundtracks were mostly brought to life by the performance of harmonica, violin and at times piano and electric guitar. The voice actors did a fantastic job portraying the characters. However, I do not recommend watching the dub, as it is one of the worst dubs I have ever seen. (Along the line with One Piece dub) 


Characters: 8

The characters were enjoyable in themselves. different kinds of personalities mixed together to make one big ball of comedy and interactions. Our first main heroine Lucy is what you'd call the "reasonist", as she is the most "sane" in the group of main characters, and usually keeps them from being too stupid (same kind of role given to Shinpachi from Gintama). Her role in the series is basically the "damsel in distress", though she can be tough when she wants to be. I liked her either way.


Next we have our first main male character, Natsu. Natsu is the short tempered, adventurous hero, who we all know and love. Having been a member since childhood, Natsu's the one who introduces both Lucy and the viewers to Fairy Tail and all it's members. In my eyes, Natsu was simply one of the coolest characters on the show, which was his job. He did a good job.


Then we have Gray, the polar opposite to Natsu, literally. No really, despite Natsu and Gray's fighting all the time, they are quite similar, though none of them is willing to admit that fact. Same as with Lucy, Gray have a certain role of "sanity" in the group, which portrays him as cool and collected (at most times), He is separated from Lucy in that aspect because of his constant fighting and competing with Natsu, and his need to walk around half naked most of the time. So all in all I love this guy XD


Erza, our second main female can be summed up in one word; scary. Don't get me wrong, I don't find her particularly scary, but everybody in the anime sure as hell does. Basically one look from her would have Natsu, who's usually not afraid of anything (A trait he shares with Luffy from One Piece), shaking at his knees and obey everything she has to say. None of the other characters are any different in that area. Through her arc though we learn she has a soft side, which made me like her a whole lot better.


The sub-characters were all enjoyable people, who I also got attached to through the series. I all in all love these characters.


Enjoyment: 7

I enjoyed watching Fairy Tail to the fullest, but forgot it rather quickly after it ended. I do still miss a new episode every Saturday, but I cope with watching other animes at the moment. 


Overall I gave Fairy Tail an 8 for it's amazing soundtrack and it's super characters. If there was anything I would have liked there to be, it would have been romance, or at least I think so. I'm really torn on that. On one side, I know I would love there to be some slight romance going on between the characters, but on the other I also know it would steer the anime away from what it really is, which is in fact a Shounen anime. So I settle for it's other amazing qualities.


I recommend you to watch this anime right now and make your own opinion on it. The more people watch it, the more of a chance we have of getting more, since it was never announced that the story of Fairy Tail is over.
